title: Likening Isaiah 12 unto Ourselves
html: Isa. 12 is Israel's "Songs of Salvation" that we will sing in the future, perhaps at Christ's coming or during the Millennium. The first hymn has been individualized with the frequent use of the first person pronouns I and me—each of us will praise the Lord with these sacred words. The second hymn will also be sung by us ("thou inhabitant of Zion"). It is not evident where we will sing these hymns: perhaps in the temple, at the gathering at Adam-ondi-Ahman, at general conference, or in other sacred settings.
